items.title: Long text in cell possibility to break it in multiple lines?
Include license file in source distribution
items.body: It would be helpful to include the license file in the source distribution. The way I've typically seen this done is with a `MANIFEST.in` file, although there are several different mechanisms, I belive.

items.title: Pypi markdown dependency different than github
items.body:
The 0.0.10 build on Pypi has a dependency of markdown==3.0.1, but the build here on github lists a dependency of 2.6.11. I'm not sure which is correct but I believe the discrepancy should be fixed.

Pypi link: https://pypi.org/project/sphinx-markdown-tables/#files
Github link to setup.py: https://github.com/ryanfox/sphinx-markdown-tables/blob/master/setup.py

items.title: Pypi release that includes parallel build fix?
items.body: In #17 the parallel read flag is set to true.  Might it be possible to get a pypi build that contains this (maybe as a minor version update?)

items.title: The install_requires of the package specifies a concrete dependency for the markdown package
items.body:
The package install_requires is requiring a specific pinned version of the markdown package which makes it impossible to install it with other extensions that require a different version of the markdown package.

If this requirement for that specific version isn't required, it should probably be an abstract dependency as defined at https://packaging.python.org/discussions/install-requires-vs-requirements/

items.title: I cant bundle image inside table.
items.body: If I write a link to the image in the table, the image will not be copied to the build.

items.title: Parallel reading warning
items.body:
When running sphinx-build I get the error below:
```
Warning, treated as error:
the sphinx_markdown_tables extension does not declare if it is safe for parallel reading, assuming it isn't - please ask the extension author to check and make it explicit
✖  sphinx-build (rtfm) failed
```

Can you mark whether this extension is safe for parallel reading? Here's a similar issue for a different extension w/ an example of marking: https://github.com/agronholm/sphinx-autodoc-typehints/issues/9

items.title: docutils table not supported
items.body:
Why is this generating raw html tables instead of docutils tables? ```html
table i
m i
```

items.title: LaTeX support?
items.body: LaTeX isn't rendered inside a table. For example, this code: ``` | Column 1 | Column 2 | | -------- | -------------- | | Row 1 | $e^{i\pi}+1=0$ | ``` It's rendered by sphinx-markdown-tables as: Another parser (Typora) will render as:

items.title: Cannot install current version (0.0.8) with pip install sphinx-markdown-tables
items.body:
Should I install an earlier version from: https://pypi.org/project/sphinx-markdown-tables/#history ?

See the attached screenshot of the error I get running pip install sphinx-markdown-tables for 0.0.8

![cannot_pip_install_sphinx-markdown-tables](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24421729/44500868-db7aaa80-a6de-11e8-8aa8-41492dad5778.png)

`Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-install-VVCrfn/sphinx-markdown-tables/`

sphinx-markdown-tables worked for HTML output (end-June) but I cannot install it now (end-Aug).

But when i tried to build the doc on readthedocs, the following errors were displayed.

Traceback (most recent call last):

items.title: NameError: name '__version__' is not defined
items.body:
Hi, using Python 3.6.5 (installed with `pyenv`), afraid it looks like version 0.0.7 is erring with the below:

```
$ sphinx-build -M html "." "_build"
Running Sphinx v1.7.6

Exception occurred:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx_markdown_tables.py", line 8, in setup
    return {'version': __version__}
NameError: name '__version__' is not defined
The full traceback has been saved in /tmp/sphinx-err-99y19ebc.log, if you want to report the issue to the developers.

$ cat /tmp/sphinx-err-99y19ebc.log
# Sphinx version: 1.7.6
# Python version: 3.6.5 (CPython)
# Docutils version: 0.14 
# Jinja2 version: 2.10
# Last messages:

# Loaded extensions:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx/cmdline.py", line 303, in main
    args.warningiserror, args.tags, args.verbosity, args.jobs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx/application.py", line 191, in __init__
    self.setup_extension(extension)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx/application.py", line 411, in setup_extension
    self.registry.load_extension(self, extname)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx/registry.py", line 326, in load_extension
    metadata = mod.setup(app)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx_markdown_tables.py", line 8, in setup
    return {'version': __version__}
NameError: name '__version__' is not defined
```

If helpful, too, it looks like `__version__.py` is getting installed into `/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages` itself, rather than in a package directory like `/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/sphinx_markdown_tables`:

```
$ ls -l /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages
...
-rwxr-xr-x  1 root staff   1212 Jul 28 15:33 sphinx_markdown_tables.py
-rwxr-xr-x  1 root staff     23 Jul 28 15:33 __version__.py
...
```

items.title: pip install failure ReadtheDocs
items.body:
requirements.txt:
```
sphinx
sphinx_rtd_theme
recommonmark
sphinx-markdown-tables
```
It seems that this package it not supported by readthedocs.

I believe the issue is from the dependency of python3.5 as it installed fine on my machine, but not the readthedocs server. (The same install error occurred on a colleagues machine with only python3.4) I tried added markdown to the requirements.txt file, however I received the same error.

`pip install -r requirements.txt`:
```bash
Requirement already satisfied: sphinx in /home/docs/checkouts/readthedocs.org/user_builds/casper-toolflow/envs/latest/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from -r docs/requirements.txt (line 1))
Requirement already satisfied: sphinx_rtd_theme in /home/docs/checkouts/readthedocs.org/user_builds/casper-toolflow/envs/latest/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from -r docs/requirements.txt (line 2))
Requirement already satisfied: recommonmark in /home/docs/checkouts/readthedocs.org/user_builds/casper-toolflow/envs/latest/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from -r docs/requirements.txt (line 3))
Collecting sphinx-markdown-tables (from -r docs/requirements.txt (line 4))
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/d6/b5/eb3e2cb2031bce2593473d6066481e848a382c1368fa1ed9a3832a2fe718/sphinx-markdown-tables-0.0.6.tar.gz
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/tmp/pip-build-HHUN5_/sphinx-markdown-tables/setup.py", line 5, in <module>
        import sphinx_markdown_tables
      File "sphinx_markdown_tables.py", line 3, in <module>
        import markdown
    ImportError: No module named markdown
    
    ----------------------------------------
```

Maybe this code should be ported to Python 2.7?

items.title: sphinx-markdown-tables can't work well for the latest recommonark
items.body:
hello,

     I'm using the latest recommonmark. And use sphinx-markdown-tables as one extension of it. 
     However, I find that sphinx-markdown-tables works well in the old version recommonmark installed by `pip install recommonmark`, but the tables are non-display when using the latest recommonmark installed by `pip install git+https://github.com/rtfd/recommonmark`.
      Could you please help me with this problem. Thanks a lot！

items.title: Python2.7 PiPy package out of date -- currently 0.0.3
items.body: The pip package for py 2.7 is still on 0.0.3, while py 3.7 has the latest version, 0.0.6. This means the newline fixes aren't available for 2.7.

items.title: Installation with pip directly in Lib/site-packages
items.body:
Is it normal that setup.py (and sphinx_markdown_tables.py but there's less risks of collisions) are installed directly in Python36/Lib/site-packages/ instead of in a new folder Python36/Lib/site-packages/sphinx_markdown_tables/ ?
And also, by the way, README.md is not copied added.

items.title: setup returns 0.0.3, actual version is 0.0.5
Do not render table if there is text between table and header
items.body:

```
